events.text: Red comments explain something that's seems counter intuitive.
Blue comments are something we could try.
Yellow comments are something we need to do.
Default formatted comments are brief summaries of functionality in plain English.
Black comments are warnings to not do something.

events.name: ALL_PARAMETERS
events.comment: The index of the parameter to forward in function calls in order to forward all parameters.

events.name: ANIMATION_DIVISOR
events.comment: The number by which to divide the movement speed to obtain the animation speed.

events.name: ARC
events.comment: The number of degrees in a circle divided by the number of angles our assets have.

events.name: AUDIO_FADE_TIME
events.comment: The duration of audio fade-ins and fade-outs, in seconds.

events.name: DEFAULT_STEREO_PAN
events.comment: The default value for the stereo pan audio parameter.

events.name: DOUBLE_OFFSET
events.comment: Used in loops when going from 1- to 0-based, also compensating for an extra token at the end.

events.name: ELLIPSIS_UPDATE_INTERVAL
events.comment: How often to add an additional ellipsis dot, in seconds.

events.name: EMPTY
events.comment: The slot identifier value that indicates this slot is empty.

events.name: END_OF_TICK
events.comment: The amount of time remaining until the end of the current tick, in seconds.

events.name: FALSE
events.comment: The numerical representation of the FALSE value.

events.name: FIRST_FRAME
events.comment: The index of the first frame of an animation.

events.name: FIRST_INSTANCE
events.comment: The index of first instance of the current picked objects.

events.name: HALF_CIRCLE
events.comment: The number of degrees in half of a circle.

events.name: INFINITE_REPEAT_COUNT
events.comment: The value needed for a tween to repeat forever.

events.name: INTERACT_COOLDOWN
events.comment: How frequently to let the player interact with things, in seconds.

events.name: ISOMETRIC_DIVIDER
events.comment: The number by which to divide projectile's and character's height to be properly isometric.

events.name: LAYOUT_FADE_TIME
events.comment: The duration of the fade-in and fade-out between layouts, in seconds.

events.name: LOOP_OFFSET
events.comment: For loops that need to either start or end at an offset.

events.name: LOOP_DEFAULT
events.comment: The default number for loops to start at.

events.name: MENU_FADE_TIME
events.comment: The duration of fade-ins and fade-outs of menus, in seconds.

events.name: NEGATIVE_HALF_CRICLE
events.comment: The number of degrees in half of a circle, made negative.

events.name: NON_DEFAULT_IMAGE_POINT
events.comment: An image point not used for Y sorting.

events.name: NON_DIRECTIONAL_INNER_ANGLE
events.comment: The inner angle audio parameter for non-directional position-based sound.

events.name: NON_DIRECTIONAL_OUTER_ANGLE
events.comment: The outer angle audio parameter for non-directional position-based sound.

events.name: NON_DIRECTIONAL_OUTER_GAIN
events.comment: The outer gain audio parameter for non-directional position-based sound.

events.name: OBJECT_ORIGIN
events.comment: The number of the value to pass to specify an object's origin.

events.name: ORIGINAL_SCALE
events.comment: The original scale value of a sprite.

events.name: PAUSED
events.comment: The value of the timescale when the game is paused.

events.name: PERCENTAGE_DIVIDER
events.comment: Used when converting percentage modifiers to flat values.

events.name: QUARTER_CIRCLE
events.comment: The number of degrees in a quarter of a circle.

events.name: SILENT
events.comment: The decibel value necessary for audio to make no sound.

events.name: SOLID_OPACITY
events.comment: The opacity value of complete solidity.

events.name: THRESHOLD
events.comment: The lowest number possible for certain stats.

events.name: TRANSPARENT_OPACITY
events.comment: The opacity value of complete transparency.

events.name: TRUE
events.comment: The numerical representation of TRUE.

events.name: TWEEN_REPEAT_COUNT
events.comment: How many times that tweens should repeat.

events.name: UNPAUSED_TIME_SCALE
events.comment: The time scale value when the game is running normally.

events.name: ALL_CLASSES_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used when checking if the player can equip an item or not.

events.name: ATTACK_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used by enemies that only have one attack animation.

events.name: BLANK
events.comment: Empty text.

events.name: BLOCK_KEYWORD
events.comment: The name of the block animation, used by the player and some NPCs.

events.name: BRIGHTNESS_EFFECT_NAME
events.comment: The name of the effect that modifies brightness on an object.

events.name: CHECKED_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for checking the animation of checkboxes.

events.name: DESCRIPTION_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for finding the column containing an object's description.

events.name: DIE_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used by the player and enemies.

events.name: EITHER_CURLY_BRACKET_REGEX
events.comment: A regular expression to match either curly bracket.

events.name: ELLIPSIS
events.comment: An ellipsis.

events.name: ELLIPSIS_DOT
events.comment: The character used to form ellipses.

events.name: EQUIPMENT_MODS_FUNCTION_MAP
events.comment: The name of the equipment mods function map.

events.name: EQUIPMENT_PROBABILITY_TABLE
events.comment: The name of the equipment probability table.

events.name: FOLDER_SEPARATOR
events.comment: The character used when drilling into project folders.

events.name: FOOTSTEP_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for the footstep sound effect names and tags.

events.name: FULL_NAME_KEYWORD
events.comment: The column that contains the beautified name of an object.

events.name: GLOBAL_FLAG
events.comment: The regular expression global flag.

events.name: GLOWHORIZONTAL_EFFECT_NAME
events.comment: The name of the effect that modifies the horizontal glow on an object.

events.name: GLOWVERTICAL_EFFECT_NAME
events.comment: The name of the effect that modifies the vertical glow on an object.

events.name: HIT_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for calling the hit animation for the player and enemies.

events.name: IDLE_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for calling the idle animation for the player, NPCs, and some enemies.

events.name: ITEM_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used when creating items.

events.name: LEVEL_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for finding the column that contains the level of equipment or an ability.

events.name: LOOT_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used when spawning loot.

events.name: MAIN_HAND_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used to check if an item is equipped in the main hand.

events.name: MENU_CLOSE_KEYWORD
events.comment: The sound effect and tag name for when menus close.

events.name: MENU_OPEN_KEYWORD
events.comment: The sound effect and tag name for when menus open.

events.name: MOD_NAME_SEPARATOR
events.comment: The character the separates a mod's name from its description.

events.name: MOD_SEPARATOR
events.comment: The character that separates mods.

events.name: MOD_TABLE_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for creating and fetching mod tables.

events.name: MOD_VALUES_PROBABILITY_TABLE
events.comment: The name of the mod values probability table.

events.name: NONE_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used as a default or empty value for various other variables.

events.name: NOT_USED
events.comment: Value to use when this field isn't utilized.

events.name: OPACITY_FADE_OUT_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for opacity tween tags.

events.name: UNCHECKED_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for checking the animation of checkboxes.

events.name: SEPARATOR
events.comment: The character used for most string delimitation, or improving readability.

events.name: SIMPLE_NAME_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for looking up simple names out of arrays.

events.name: SWING_WEAPON_SOUND_EFFECT_NAME
events.comment: The name of the 'Swing Weapon' sound effect.

events.name: WALK_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used by the player and enemies.

events.name: dialogVolume
events.comment: How loudly to play dialog, in decibels.

events.name: soundEffectsVolume
events.comment: How loudly to play sound effects, in decibels.

events.name: interfaceVolume
events.comment: How loudly to place interface sound effects, in decibels.

events.name: musicVolume
events.comment: How loudly to play the music, in decibels.

events.name: nextAvailableIdentifier
events.comment: Stores the next available identifier, to be assigned to equipment.

events.name: uidOfClicked
events.comment: The UID of the object that the player clicked.

events.name: isOnInteractCooldown
events.comment: Whether or not the player is allowed to interact with objects.

children.name: PORTRAIT_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for interacting with the portrait layer.

children.name: MESSAGE_COLUMN_HEADER
children.comment: The header of the column that contains NPC messages.

children.name: PORTRAIT_POSITION
children.comment: The position on the X axis of where the portrait should spawn

actions.text: Close the merchant menu if the player gets too far away from the merchant to whose shop is being displayed.
Don't execute if the portrait is fading. Pick only the NPC and corresponding body that the player is talking to, to check if they were clicked in the next subevent.

children.name: DIALOG_COUNTER_INCREMENTER
children.comment: By how much to increase the dialog counter for each NPC dialog.

actions.text: If this NPC doesn't have any more dialog, close the dialog.

children.name: VIEWPORT_OFFSET
children.comment: How much to offset the portrait from the bottom of the viewport, in pixels.

actions.text: Parent it to the dialog so it resizes correctly.

children.name: INITIAL_DIALOG_COUNTER_VALUE
children.comment: The number at which the dialog counter begins.

children.functionDescription: End dialog with an NPC.

actions.text: This wait is the official recommended method to unload an object after destroying it.

children.name: allowEquipmentInteraction
children.comment: Whether or not the player is currently allowed to interact with equipment.

children.name: swapIdentifier
children.comment: The saved identifier for swapping.

children.name: swapSlotUid
children.comment: The UID of the original slot in a swap.

children.name: draggedOriginSlotUid
children.comment: The UID of the slot from which the drag originated.

children.name: draggedItemUid
children.comment: The UID of the item being dragged.

children.name: droppedOnSlotUid
children.comment: The UID of the slot on which the item was dropped.

children.functionDescription: Attempt to pick up loot, either equipping it or adding it to the inventory.

children.name: OBTAINED_ITEM_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for playing the sound effect when an item is obtained.

actions.text: if auto equip is enabled, and the player's class matches the loot's restrictions, pick the first empty slot matching the loot's type, and spawn the item there
if auto equip is disabled, or there's no empty slots matching the item's type, spawn the item in the first empty inventory slot.

children.functionDescription: Sets all the necessary variables for this item from a loot.

children.name: TRAVEL_TIME
children.comment: The amount of time it takes loot to get to its destination.

children.name: ASCENSION_TWEEN_TAG
children.comment: The tag name of the tween that launches the loot up in the air.

children.name: TRAVEL_TIME_DIVIDER
children.comment: The value by which to divide the travel time, to split between the tweens.

children.name: IDENTIFIER_INCREMENTER
children.comment: How much to increment the identifier every time we use its value.

actions.text: This isn't a part of the 'spawnLoot' function because we need it to work for loot that's already in a layout.

children.functionDescription: Create a piece of loot.

children.name: LOOT_ALTITUDE
children.comment: How high the loot should fly up into the air after it spawns.

children.name: LOOT_DISTANCE
children.comment: How far away to launch this loot, in pixels.

children.name: isometrifiedLootDistance
children.comment: The loot distance, made isometric.

children.name: INITIAL_SCALE
children.comment: The scale at which loot initially spawns.

children.name: SOUND_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for finding the sound column.

children.name: CLASS_RESTRICTIONS_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for looking up the class restrictions column.

children.name: VALUE_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for looking up the (coin) value column.

children.name: LORE_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for looking up the lore column.

children.name: TYPE_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for looking up the type column.

children.name: SIMPLE_NAME_INDEX
children.comment: The index of the simple name in an loot's name.

actions.text: TODO: Push loot out of props, enemies, chests, etc. into which it gets launched.
https://github.com/Laserwolve-Games/DaggerQuest/issues/38

children.name: MIN_MODS
children.comment: The minimum number of mods an item can have.

children.name: MAX_MODS
children.comment: The maximum number of mods an item can have.

children.name: chosenMod
children.comment: The mod chosen to be added to this loot.

children.name: SQUARE_BRACKET_REGEX
children.comment: A regular expression to get everything between square brackets.

children.name: modValue
children.comment: The text inside the brackets of a given mod.

children.name: EITHER_SQUARE_BRACKET_REGEX
children.comment: A regular expression to find either of the square brackets.

children.name: FIRST_BRACKETS_INDEX
children.comment: The index of the first set of brackets in a mod.

actions.text: For each set of square brackets in this loot's mods...

parameters.value: RegexReplace(RegexMatchAt(loot.mods, SQUARE_BRACKET_REGEX, NOT_USED, FIRST_BRACKETS_INDEX), EITHER_SQUARE_BRACKET_REGEX, GLOBAL_FLAG, BLANK)

children.name: LEFT_MOD_BRACKET
children.comment: The opening bracket for a mod's value.

children.name: MOD_VALUE_SEPARATOR
children.comment: The character used to indicate a range in a numerical mod value.

children.name: RIGHT_MOD_BRACKET
children.comment: The closing bracket for a mod's value.

children.name: upperLimit
children.comment: the highest number that this mod can roll

children.name: lowerLimit
children.comment: the lowest number that this mod can roll

children.name: LOWER_LIMIT_INDEX
children.comment: The index of the lower limit value in a mod.

children.name: UPPER_LIMIT_INDEX
children.comment: The index of the upper limit value in a mod.

children.name: TEXT_VALUE_PARSER
children.comment: The character used to parse out text values in a mod.

actions.text: if this particular value contains the mod separator, it's a numeric value

children.text:
The larger the numeric range, the rarer higher values will be. The higher RARITY_DIMINISHER is, the more common higher values will be. No matter what value RARITY_DIMINISHER is, each value will always be less common than the value before it, if there is one.

With RARITY_DIMISHER at 1, a mod like +{1-10} Slash Damage has an approximately 1.81% chance to roll 10.

children.name: RARITY_DIMINISHER
children.comment: How rare higher values are.

actions.text: Set a numeric mod's value to a random number between the lower and upper limit.
Add the loot's level to the value that was rolled.

parameters.value: RegexReplace(Self.mods, SQUARE_BRACKET_REGEX, BLANK, LEFT_MOD_BRACKET & advancedRandom.Weighted + loot.level & RIGHT_MOD_BRACKET)

children.name: ANY_WEIGHT
children.comment: The weight value to specify any possible weight.

actions.text: We can't remove an entire mod table, so remove the entries the same way we added them.

children.text: For text mod values, select a choice at random

actions.text: if it doesn't, it should contain a dollar sign, which means it's a text value

parameters.value: RegexReplace(Self.mods, SQUARE_BRACKET_REGEX, NOT_USED, LEFT_MOD_BRACKET & tokenat(modValue, floor(random(tokencount(modValue, TEXT_VALUE_PARSER))), TEXT_VALUE_PARSER) & RIGHT_MOD_BRACKET)

children.functionDescription: Set this loot's animation to a random one.

actions.text: We don't have a way to tell how many animations a sprite has, so we have to hardcode these values.

children.name: STATIC_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used in animation names of static sprites.

children.name: FIRST_ANIMATION_INDEX
children.comment: The 1-based index of the first animation.

children.name: LAST_ANIMATION_INDEX
children.comment: The 1-based index of the last animation.

actions.text: If an item is right clicked while it's not being dragged, and the inventory menu is open...
...if the equipped menu is open...
...and the item is in the equipped menu...
...check to see if there's any empty inventory slots the item can go into.
If there are, detach the item from its current slot...
Then attach it to the first empty inventory slot.
TODO: Play audio "I can't carry any more"
...and the item is in the in the inventory menu...
...and can be equipped...
Pick the equipped menu slots that match the item's type.
Of those slots, check if any are empty.
Now that we know there's an empty equipped menu slot for this item, go back to the inventory menu slot holding our item, and detach.
Re-pick the first empty equipped menu slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it.

If no slots are empty, start a swap. Pick the first equipped menu slot (necessary in the case of rings, because there are two slots) and store its identifier, which is also the identifier of the item in it.
Go back to the slot holding our item, and detach. save this slot's UID so we know where to put the other item.
Re-pick the first equipped menu slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it, even though it has an different item in it.

Now we have both items in the same slot. We'll detach the item that shouldn't be there, picking it with 'swapID'. We don't need to clear the identifier value because it was already set correctly in the previous event.
TODO: Play audio "I don't meet the requirements for this item".
...if the merchant menu is open...
...and the item is in the merchant menu...
...check to see if there's any empty inventory slots the item can go into.
Check if the player can pay for the item, and if so, charge them.
If there are, detach the item from its current slot...
...then attach it to the first empty inventory slot.
TODO: Play audio "I have insufficient gold".
TODO: Play audio "I can't carry any more" or "I have no room for this purchase".
...and the item is in the in the inventory menu...
This else is necessary so that only one thing happens to the item per right click.
Pick the slots on the merchant menu.
Pick the empty slots.
Now that we know there's an empty merchant menu slot for this item, go back to the inventory menu slot holding our item, and detach.
Re-pick the first empty merchant menu slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it.
TODO: If there's no empty slots on the merchant menu, the merchant plays the dialog line "I have no more room to purchase items".
TODO: Play audio "I don't meet the requirements for this item".

children.name: OVERLAY_LAYER_NAME
children.comment: The name of the overlay layer.

children.name: ITEM_OPACITY
children.comment: The opacity of items when they're being dragged.

actions.text: when an item starts being dragged, record where it came from, set dragging to true, and detach it
This ensures whatever is being dragged is always on top
if the item was dropped over a slot...
and that slot's type was none, or it's the same as the item's type, and the player meets all the requirements to equip it...
if the slot that was dropped over is on the merchant menu...
...and it's empty, put the item there...
and give the player the appropriate amount of coins if the item didn't originally also come from the merchant menu
...and it's not empty. send the item back. We don't swap items from the merchant menu.
if the item that was dropped came from the merchant menu...
...and it was dropped an an empty slot...
charge the player for the item and give it to them, provided they have enough coins
"I don't have enough coins for this purchase"
...and it was dropped on a slot that wasn't empty, return it. No swapping from the merchant menu.
only allow drag and drop swapping when neither the origin or destination slot are on the merchant menu
and that slot is not empty, save its identifier (which is also its item's identifier) so we can overwrite it
check if the item can go back to the origin slot
if it can, re-pick the item being dragged, and the slot we dropped it on, and attach them
now pick and detach the overlapped item that shouldn't be there (but the slot's identifier is OK), and pick the origin slot, and attach the two
if it can't, don't swap, and send the item being dragged back to the origin slot
send the item back to the slot it came from
Can't have an else condition in an OR block.
if the item was dropped on an invalid location, send the item back to the slot it came from
if the item is dropped over the background, and it didn't come from the merchant menu, turn it into loot.
Transfer data from the item to the loot, then destroy the item.
Prevent items from being dropped outside the window.

children.functionDescription: Determine whether a specified item can go into a specified slot. Returns 1 for true and 0 for false.

parameters.value: item.level <= player.level & slot.type = item.type & (Functions.contains(item.classRestrictions, ALL_CLASSES_KEYWORD) | Functions.contains(item.classRestrictions, body.ObjectTypeName))

children.functionDescription: Send a dragged item back to the slot from which it came.
Attach this item to this slot.
Detach this item from this slot.

children.text: Using variables and functions to clean up these events leads to bizarre timing issues that are hard to troubleshoot.

children.functionDescription: Queue up an item to have its gear and mods managed.

functionParameters.name: active
functionParameters.comment: Whether or not to activate or deactivate mods for this item.

children.name: allowGearManagement
children.comment: Whether or not the below events are currently running.

children.name: GEAR_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for spawning gear.

actions.text: if there's an item in this slot, spawn its gear

children.name: EQUIP_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for equip sound effects.

actions.text: This won't destroy the gear that was just created. Only gear(s) that pertained to this slot beforehand get destroyed.

children.text: We are playing the equip noise for the item that just got equipped right now, so we don't need to play an unequip noise.

actions.text: If there's no item in this slot...

children.name: CHEST_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for default gear conditions.

children.name: LEGS_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for default gear conditions.

children.name: HEAD_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for default gear conditions.

children.name: DEFAULT_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for default gear conditions.

children.name: UNEQUIP_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for the unequip sound effect name.

actions.text: ...and the slot is chest and the player is one of the female classes, or legs or head, (the slots that have default gear), load the default gear.

parameters.object: body.ObjectTypeName & SEPARATOR & slot.type & DEFAULT_KEYWORD & SEPARATOR & GEAR_KEYWORD

parameters.object-name: body.ObjectTypeName & SEPARATOR & slot.type & DEFAULT_KEYWORD & SEPARATOR & GEAR_KEYWORD

actions.text: ...destroy the (non-default) gear that was affiliated with this slot. This won't destroy the default gear that was just created.

weird positioning because we only want the unequip audio to play if it isn't playing already, and only if non-default gear is getting destroyed, but we don't need to wait until it's unloaded from memory to play this.
If there's no default gear for this slot, just destroy the gear and then we're done.
If there was no gear to destroy, the item was (probably?) unequipped before its gear could load. We don't need to do anything, except allow gear management again.

children.text: Event order here is very important.

children.functionDescription: Modify a value based on an angle, to make it isometrically correct.

functionParameters.name: value
functionParameters.comment: The value, which will be modified by the specified angle.

functionParameters.name: theAngle
functionParameters.comment: The angle, which will be used to modify the specified value.

children.name: CAMERA_ANGLE
children.comment: The camera angle, on a scale of 0 to 1.

children.name: MAX_ANGLE
children.comment: The highest possible camera angle.

parameters.value: value * lerp(CAMERA_ANGLE, MAX_ANGLE, abs(abs(theAngle) - QUARTER_CIRCLE) / QUARTER_CIRCLE)

actions.text: loot with a parent prop needs to always be in front of that prop.

children.text: If the player is facing right, put the mainHand gear on top of the sort stack, and offHand on the bottom. If they're facing left, do the opposite.
We have lots of variables, like 'uidOfClicked', that should be scoped down onto the player.

children.name: INITIAL_VALUE
children.comment: The player variable values when they don't need to relocate.

children.name: EXPERIENCE_THRESHOLD_MULTIPLIER
children.comment: The number by which the player's level is multiplied to determine the experience threshold.

children.name: LEVEL_INCREMENTER
children.comment: How many levels to go up when the experience threshold is reached.

children.functionDescription: Level up the player.

actions.text: It would be too much technical overhead to update to the ability selector while it's open, so just close it when the player levels up. It'll be pretty hard to level up with it open, anyways.

children.name: OFFSET
children.comment: Used to offset the player's level when looking up an ability.

children.functionDescription: Update the facing of the player.

actions.text: This is a custom action so it can be called in the middle of a player ability function.

children.name: REGEN_SPEED
children.comment: How often the player regenerates health and mana, in seconds.

actions.text: Regenerate health and mana while not at the maximum values, only while alive.

children.functionDescription: Whether or not the player is alive.

children.text: TODO: See enemy footstep sound effect events.

children.name: LEFT_FOOTSTEP_FRAME
children.comment: The frame in which the left footstep touches the ground.

children.name: RIGHT_FOOTSTEP_FRAME
children.comment: The frame in which the right footstep touches the ground.

actions.text: Only allow interaction with loot chests that haven't been opened.
Only allow movement when no items are being dragged.
'cursor is not over player' is here and not with the other 'cursor is over' conditions to facilitate picking up loot under the player.

Try refactoring 'cursor is over player' be an isometric circle around the player. The size of this isometric circle would be based on the players movement speed; the faster the player is moving, the larger the circle would need to be to prevent the animation stutter.
If the mouse isn't over any of the aforementioned, reset 'uidOfClicked' and walk there normally.
As soon as the enemy comes in range, stop moving and attack it.

parameters.value: Functions.isInRange((player.pickupRange + max(loot.Width, loot.Height)) + loot.pickupRangeBonus, loot.X, loot.Y)

children.name: UID_OF_CLICKED_RESET_TIMER
children.comment: How often to reset 'uidOfClicked', in seconds.

actions.text: Reset 'uidOfClicked' if the player isn't moving. Otherwise, if the clicked object later entered into the player's interact range by its own locomotion, the player would interact with it. Give a small leeway timer to assist with interacting with objects immediately adjacent to the player.

children.functionDescription: Move the player to a specified location.

functionParameters.name: x
functionParameters.comment: The coordinate on the X axis to which to move the player.

functionParameters.name: y
functionParameters.comment: The coordinate on the Y axis to which to move the player.

children.name: MOVEMENT_AND_INTERACTION_GROUP_NAME
children.comment: The name of the group that handles movement and interaction.

children.name: ABILITIES_GROUP_NAME
children.comment: The name of the group that handles abilities.

children.name: FACINGS_GROUP_NAME
children.comment: The name of the group that handles facings.

children.text: These functions can't be inside of 'movement and interaction', since they disable or enable that group.

children.functionDescription: Prevent the player from doing anything.
Allow the player to move and use abilities.

actions.text: When a key is down, if the game isn't paused and the player is in a combat area, pick the specified ability key binder, slot and ability. If there is an ability in that slot, call the relevant function.

The loop is necessary because there's no 'any key is down' keyboard condition. Using the 'on any key pressed' trigger instead of this loop prevents us from holding down a key to repeatedly cast an ability.

children.name: DOWNWARD_SLASH_ANIMATION_NAME
children.comment: The name of the Downward Slash animation.

children.name: UPWARD_SLASH_ANIMATION_NAME
children.comment: The name of the Upward Slash animation.

children.name: KICK_ANIMATION_NAME
children.comment: The name of the Kick animation.

children.functionDescription: The basic attack for this class.

actions.text: This is a custom action and not an instance signal so we can get the coordinates of the enemy that was clicked.

children.name: PROJECTILE_SPEED

actions.text: must have enough mana
Using the 'Is moving' condition, instead of this condition, causes the player to continue the walking animation when grinding into solids.
If the player was not where they were last tick, record that location.
if they were already walking, play the walk animation from the current frame.
If they were idling, play the walk animation, from the beginning.
If the player isn't moving and not dead, and they were previously walking, (and the timescale isn't paused) make him start idling.
Compensate for floating point math: https://github.com/Scirra/Construct-3-bugs/issues/5895
If we replaced these with in-line waits, we would lose the ability to change animation speeds while they were played.

actions.text: Here we handle what happens when the enemy successfully arrives at their destination.
If they successfully moved backward, now the enemy will go left.
If they successfully went left, they're done; they can resume normal behavior.
If they successfully went right, they're done; they can resume normal behavior.
If they successfully moved backward a second time, try going left again. No need to record that this would be the 2nd left attempt.

children.name: DISTANCE_MULTIPLIER
children.comment: How much further to go in this reroute attempt.

actions.text: If an enemy hit a solid while moving, they need to go somewhere else. They can't stop because they don't have an idle animation.
If the enemy wasn't already rerouting when he hit a solid, begin rerouting by going backward.
If the enemy hit a solid while going backward, try going left.
If the enemy hit a solid while going left, try going right. Go further than previously attempt, to prevent loops.
If the enemy hit a solid while going right, try backing up again.
If the enemy hit a solid while backing up again, they are probably stuck. Reset the rerouting process to try again.
Pick dead enemies and their bodies. Trim down the selection of enemies to only those who are parents of bodies that aren't playing a DIE_KEYWORD animation.

children.name: ENEMY_DEATH_FADE_OUT_TIME
children.comment: How long to fade out the body of a dead enemy, in seconds.

actions.text: The point in time when the projectile should appear differs based on which direction the enemy is facing. (i.e., the distance between the enemy's origin and hand is drastically different if he's facing left, vs. if he's facing up)
Time the spawning of the projectile so it will pass over the manifestation point during the same frame that the the projectile's visual representation on the enemy disappears.
Adjust the projectile's speed to account for isometry.
If we set the angle before we set the speed, and the speed of the projectile on the main menu is 0, this projectile will only flight straight left or right.
The projectile is now at the manifestation point. Spawn the projectile's visual representation.
'arrowShot' is a short enough sound effect that we should play it in its entirety even the crossbow bolt is destroyed before the audio can complete, so don't use a tag here.

children.text: The player's shadows are global because we add them to a layout, check the 'global' checkbox, then delete them from that layout.

actions.text: If this object already has a shadow, do nothing

children.text: If we change this boolean to affirm positive instead of negative (e.g., changing it to 'createShadow'), newly created hasShadows won't have shadows created for them since booleans for items that don't already exist on a layout are false.

children.text: Having a projectile object on the main menu in the margin prevents an issue where 'bullet - set angle of motion' only ever sets the projectile's angle of motion to either 0 or 180.

actions.text: The destruction of non-global objects on layout change appears takes place after the event sheet of that layout loses authority. We must destroy projectiles in an 'On end of layout' trigger so 'projectile On destroyed' triggers still fire.

We could shear the shape of projectiles using mesh points when they collide with a prop.
We could have a boolean flag on props that they can be attacked over.

children.text: TODO: The only reason we don't play the hit and block animations in non-combat areas is because our non-combat idle animation is posed significantly differently than those two animations. It would look bad. Once we get different animations, remove those conditions.

actions.text: If the player isn't in a non-combat area, isn't currently channeling, and successfully blocks the attack, play the block animation, then we're done.
If the projectile didn't get blocked...
If the player isn't currently channeling, isn't in a non-combat area, and the hit doesn't kill him, and the hit overcomes the flinch resistance, the player flinches.

actions.text: save the bbox of the door on it's first frame, to be used to detect when the mouse is over it

Check that the mouse is within a box that's the shape of the door on the door's first frame. This prevents a graphical issue where the door would open enough so that the mouse would no longer be over the door, so the door would start to shut, thus being under the mouse again, repeat ad infinitum (and every tick)
If we mouse over two different doors very quickly, the animations might get messed up since this is an 'else', not sure
